entry.title: updater: pick up usagestats for Windows
entry.content:
This CL fixes an issue with usage stats not being picked up before the

Wake task runs, by reading the raw usage stats from the registry.



This allows for:

* any crashes that happen before the Wake task to get uploaded.

* any appcommands that run before the Wake task to ping.



Fixed: 325316125

entry.title: [BREFs] Fix error when mixing meta/header tokens
entry.content:
BREFs doesn't support header tokens, but this means we failed to test

what happens when meta and header tokens are mixed. As it turns out,

what happens it that the origin_trial_state_host_remote_ that's bound

when processing header tokens expires and future calls fail. We can

prevent this by checking if the remote isn't connected and resetting it

if so.



Bug: 326458800, 40243430

Change-Id: I2fd0f51466cdbef0923db14ef71f534047c54546

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5318841

Reviewed-by: Steven Bingler

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1264741}

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Migrate flat V4L2 stateless decoder to FrameResource
entry.content:
This renames OutputQueue::CreateVideoFrame to CreateFrame and changes

the return type to FrameResource. This uses the adaptation class

VideoFrameResource to wrap the VideoFrame that is created by wrapping

the DMABuf's from the v4l2_buffer.



When the NativePixmap-based FrameResource is ready, CreateFrame will

switch to use that.

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Migrate flat V4L2 stateful decoder to FrameResource
entry.content:
The change is in a few parts. It switches to the FrameResource

V4L2Queue::QueueDMABuf() for all frame types. For MMAP frames,

V4L2ReadableBuffer::GetFrameResource() is used to get to get a

FrameResource from the MMAP V4L2 buffers.



For DMA buffer frames, the frame pool GetFrame() method still returns a

VideoFrame, so the frames are wrapped in a VideoFrameResource as they

are retrieved from the frame pool. Note: A later commit will change the

frame pool to use FrameResource natively. At that time, local use of

VideoFrameResource will not be necessary.



Bug: b:277581596

Test: Decode tests pass on Trogdor with flat decoder enabled



Change-Id: Ie2a9976afcb7a2de6338aa861fda784c57bc4def

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5282523

Reviewed-by: Fritz Koenig

Commit-Queue: Nathan Hebert

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1264733}

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Migrate V4L2 decoder to FrameResource
entry.content:
The frame pool GetFrame() method still returns a VideoFrame, so wrap it

as a VideoFrameResource before using it. For MMAP frames, this changes

the decoder to use the FrameResource V4L2Queue interfaces.

entry.content:
The frame pool GetFrame() method still returns a VideoFrame, so wrap it

as a VideoFrameResource before using it. A later commit will change the

frame pool to use FrameResource natively. At that time, the

VideoFrameResource wrapping will not be necessary.

updated when the frame pool is updated.

entry.title: Set GPU subpixel rendering setting later in initialization
entry.content:
This change removes the last remaining usage of FontConfig early in

initialization (the next later one occurs after browser window

creation, during rendering). This is enough for cost of FcInit()

(30ms-100ms) to be fully masked while it runs on a worker thread.



R=thestig,sky



Fixed: 1523810

entry.title: [CodeHealth] Rewrite an old-style WPT using promises.
entry.content:
This CL rewrites pointerevent_click_during_capture.html to:

- replace a complicated state-machine logic with 4 independent

promise_tests that are easier to reason about and debug,

- renames all targets for better readablity, and

- adds a new "symmetrical" test (the 4th promise_test) that captures

the pointer to the `pointerdown` target, for completeness.



This is a no-op change.



For a captured pointer, the WPT wrongly assumes that the click event

is dispatched before the lostpointercapture event. This gap will be

fixed in the follow-up CL.



Bug: 40851596

Change-Id: I52c32afccba1faa5475ab5f5ff7d4132232ddeee

entry.title: IDB: break browser process code into own build target
entry.content:
Instead of building as part of //content/browser, create a source_set

for core IDB code. This has the following benefits:



a) better dependency management: core IDB code is barred from depending

on most of //content

b) object names: we'll no longer need to prefix every file with

"indexed_db_" for fear of colliding with other source files in

//content



The internals UI has a lot of its own dependencies, so it's left alone.

Test code also depends heavily on //content, so it too is left as

part of the content test targets.



Bug: 326376203

Change-Id: I2e2b4518e84333ac326fa6ca70a2de6fb2f2fa42

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5319130

Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

entry.title: [Extensions] Add more metrics for corrupted files
entry.content:
We're seeing some reports of extension corruption increasing.

Add more metrics to help quantify and identify the type of corruption

happening. In particular, add metrics to determine corruption rates

across manifest versions and across extension file types.



Tracking the file type required rejiggering some of the internals

of ContentVerifier to keep track of the file types being verified. To

do this, we pull out the "should verify" logic into a helper class.

entry.title: [picture-in-picture] Disable permission prompt buttons when occluded
entry.content:
Currently, permission prompts check whether a picture-in-picture window

occludes the button row before allowing keyboard input to click a

button. However, there are still ways in which this can be abused by a

nefarious website.



This CL strengthens that check to not allow any input to click a button

as long as any of the prompt is occluded by a picture-in-picture

window.

entry.title: [Fuchsia] Import gn-sdk from flutter/engine
entry.content:
This change imports some missing features from

https://github.com/flutter/engine/tree/main/tools/fuchsia/gn-sdk

so that flutter can use the same gn-sdk rather than maintaining a

different copy.

Note, the gn-sdk in flutter does not support idk version which can be

addressed by https://github.com/flutter/engine/pull/50855 and its

follow-up changes.



Beside the missing features, it also improves the compatibility of

the gn-sdk to

1) allow customized gn_configs.gni instead of a hard-coded location.

2) handle several edge cases, like duplicated 'meta/' or '.cml', and missing folders.



The change itself should be transparent to chromium, newly added

features won't be enabled without explicitly using the relevant

parameters or gn arguments.



Bug: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/140179

Change-Id: I5b27f286de5abd877ce81404759b179a2743b426

node tree instead of HTML text. Text nodes are aggregated into

within a specified word limit. Exceeding the word limit is possible

but the aggregation process avoids it.

entry.title: [dPWA] Make the WebAppInstallDialogCoordinator be a WidgetObserver
entry.content:
Instead of using a raw_ptr to a bubble dialog delegate and then using

a WeakPtr to itself everywhere inside the view, the install dialog

coordinator for web apps is now a WidgetObserver. This ensures:

1. Simple lifetimes, since the view inside the coordinator is

tracked only as long as the WidgetObserver is observing the main

dialog, which is more robust than the previous implementation of

a criss-cross raw_ptr, weak_ptr interface.

2. Practices separation of concerns, and brings the implementation

closer to a MVC model, where the behavior, view and its observation

happens independent of each other, with no overlapping logic.



As a side note, this also fixes the measurement of the

WebApp.InstallConfirmation.CloseReason by moving it to a central

location to be used by both the old and new install dialogs.



Bug: b/326418546

Change-Id: I7672d82d1683aa45ce9e51a37d3fef2e1d0c0a22

entry.title: adb_logcat_monitor: remove initial logging.basicConfig
entry.content:
I added the initial call to logging.basicConfig() by mistake. A correct

call is done shortly after in main(), and redirects all logging into the

file 'eventlog'.



When running as a daemon, the initial call to basicConfig() wants to do

something with stdout/stderr, but they are already redirected to

/dev/null by dup2. This state seems to confuse the Python logging

module, so we lose log messages, and even the later call to

basicConfig() does not help.



Let's remove the initial call to logging.basicConfig().



Bug: 324927538

entry.title: [Passwords] Don't do password leak check if it can't be muted
entry.content:
The filed bug report contained several problems:



1) Password leak check ignored broken `PasswordStore`. `PasswordStore`

stored if any leak notification was already shown to the user and

allowed to show the leak notification at most once. Since

`PasswordStore` was broken, the user was prompted with

password leak every time they login to the website.



2) If the saving was disabled, form manager was not cleared and this

meant that every website navigation was form submission.



This lead to Password Manager prompting leaked password dialog on

every navigation.



Move password leak check after checking that password store is

available for write and clear the submitted form even if saving is

disabled.



Bug: b/326402007

Change-Id: Ic43c34f33b0315ae645affee3b5398ecc221007a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5317876

Reviewed-by: Vasilii Sukhanov

Commit-Queue: Din Nezametdinov

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1264635}

entry.title: Fix up bdo behavior with unicode-bidi property
entry.content:
See the predecessor CLs [1][2] which fixed up other elements. This

CL updates the bdo element UA stylesheet and some management code

in html_element.cc.



In particular, this CL makes the following changes to html.css:



add this:

[dir=ltr i], [dir=rtl i], [dir=auto i] {

unicode-bidi: isolate;

}



and then replace this:

bdo {

unicode-bidi: bidi-override;

}

with this:

bdo, bdo[dir] {

unicode-bidi: isolate-override;

}



That is per spec:

https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/rendering.html#bidi-rendering



Several tests had to be updated to match bdo's isolate-override

behavior.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5240082

[2] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5260610

entry.title: webauthn: make the enclave state file a valid protobuf.
entry.content:
The EnclaveManager's state is serialised as a protobuf. But, in order to

make sure that it doesn't get corrupted, a SHA-256 hash of the contents

is appended. But that makes the file no longer a protobuf, which is a

little sad: `protoc --decode_raw` is useful.



Thus, when appending the hash, a three bytes that happen to be the

prefix of a 32-byte value with tag 1024. Thus the file remains a valid

protobuf.



Change-Id: If6b4964ffb213879ba76f320530c757b0bb48a71

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5310035

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1264622}

entry.title: webauthn: serialise EnclaveManager state at the right time.
entry.content:
If `WriteState` was called while a write was already in progress, the

code would set a flag and start a new write once the current one

completed. But that would mean that it would grab the state when the

write completed, rather than the state at the time at the write was

requested.



That should be fine, but it's a bit of non-determinism that feels a

little sharp, so change it to always capture the state at the time that

`WriteState` was called.



Change-Id: Ie31da1f6a26bbd6b4810b63e6c1b2a8276b21fef

entry.title: [FedCM] Reject button flow request without delay
entry.content:
The button flow is on a critical path so RPs should see the failures as

soon as possible to fallback to other sign-in mechanism. In addition,

the button flow does NOT have the same risk of leaking IdP status as the

widget flow does. e.g. when an RP doesn't get an immediate response, it

cannot differentiate the following two cases:

1. if a user doesn't have an account with the IdP, we show the "Sign

in to IdP pop-up window" and reject the promise when the user closes

it.

2. if a user has an account with the IdP, we show the account UI and

reject the promie if the flow fails afterwards.



Therefore we don't need to add random delays like we do in the widget

flow.



This patch also fixes an rp_mode_ assignment issue.



Bug: 41482138

Change-Id: Ieccc1f526b18540d0cda3d6b338e1d9a1843a565

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5318058

entry.title: Revert "WebUI: Fix some undeclared gn inputs in ts_library() targets"
entry.content:
This reverts commit ab34f63393b707ed8791634ca35be73ead38393c.



Reason for revert: breaks ChromeOS-Chrome builds

e.g.



assert validateMapping(mapping_path, mapping[0], args.root_gen_dir,

AssertionError: mnt/nvme1/chrome/src/out_brya/common/tsc/* is not in root_gen_dir. |path_mappings| should only map to generated directories, so that a corresponding target can be added in in |deps|.

[26985/87881] ACTION //chrome/browser/resources/chromeos/accessibility/chromevox:ts_build(//build/toolchain/cros:target)



Original change's description:

> WebUI: Fix some undeclared gn inputs in ts_library() targets

>

> When ts_library() path_mappings are used to map URL prefixes to

> directories in src/, any files that are imported are dependencies of

> the ts_library() target but are not added to |inputs| for gn and are

> not directly generated by any dependency of the target. This leads to

> compile failures in remote execution environments.

>

> This CL

> (1) Adds validation for any path_mapping, that the mapping corresponds

> to a generated directory and not a src directory.

> (2) Adds exceptions for a few auto-mapped cases that are safe since

> they are only added when a dependency on a target that depends on

> all .d.ts files within the folder is added.

> (3) Also adds exceptions for some possibly unsafe infra-related and

> CrOS specific cases, which should be investigated later.

> (4) Fixes the cases causing the specific failures in the bug, by adding

> targets preprocessing definitions files to a generated directory

> and then adding dependencies on these targets in all locations

> using the path_mapping.

>

> Bug: 326005022

> Change-Id: I9e9c75044bd75ad5e9521a2834eb8b67400f6a0e

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5315956

> Reviewed-by: Demetrios Papadopoulos

> Commit-Queue: Rebekah Potter

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1264316}



Bug: 326005022

Change-Id: Icc6e9856672f64fb507735d603d42366badfdf24

entry.content:
IOSurfaceImageBacking's DawnRepresentation currently misses calling into

the backing's EndAccess() on its own EndAccess() if there is still

another ongoing Dawn access to the texture that the representation is

holding. However, we actually need to invoke the backing's EndAccess()

in this case so that it can properly decrement its counter of the number

of overall ongoing accesses. This CL fixes that issue.



NOTE: This CL will not fix crbug.com/325408101, as we saw the

concurrent read/write signaled at the level of SharedTextureMemory before I had introduced the backing-level checking. However, it does get

rid of errors that were obscuring whatever actual problematic access

pattern is occurring there.



Bug: 325408101

entry.content:
This commit enables the guest WebContents to respect the owner

WebContents' muted state. This is done by checking the owner's muted

state prior to setting the muted state for the guest, and only unmuting when the owner is also unmuted. It uses the existing GuestViewBase's

owner WebContents observer to detect the changes in audio muted state.

entry.title: [IP Protection] Add GetProxyListResult and ProxyListRefreshTime histograms
entry.content:
Adds a NetworkService.IpProtection.GetProxyListResult histogram to

measure whether proxy list retrieval is successful. The histogram

distinguishes between three cases:



- Failure to get any list

- Got a list, but it had no (acceptable) proxy chains

- Got a list with (at least some) acceptable proxy chains



Also adds a NetworkService.IpProtection.ProxyListRefreshTime histogram

to measure the time taken to refresh a proxy list.

entry.title: Stop recording Signin.Signin.Started for reauth events
entry.content:
Clicking on "Sign in again" button while in the Sync paused state

eventually triggers `SigninViewController::ShowDiceSigninTab()` with

`signin_reason` set to kSigninPrimaryAccount. In its turn, this leads to

Signin.Signin.Started UMA being recorded at [1].



This is incorrect as Signin.Signin.Completed is never recorded at the

end of this flow since no new account is added to Chrome in the result.



To fix this, this CL changes the `signin_reason` to

`kReauthentication` if `ShowDiceAddAccountTab()` is called with an

email hint that points at an account that is known to the

`IdentityManager`. The user can still change this account on the Gaia

sign-in page which will make Signin.Signin.Started miss a

corresponding event. We believe that happens relatively rare.



As part of this change, reauthentication flows will start using the

regular sign-in URL instead of the Chrome Sync URL since the sync

prompt is never displayed in reauth flows [2].



[1] https://crsrc.org/c/chrome/browser/signin/dice_tab_helper.cc;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090;l=117

[2] https://crsrc.org/c/chrome/browser/signin/dice_tab_helper.cc;drc=28bad3b5120911c529daebdf42cc69167dc8f55c;l=107



Fixed: 325102895

Change-Id: I6ac72828db95196312ef7c7d0f97178e306be7fa

entry.title: [css-functions] Support invalidation.
entry.content:
If we insert, remove or change a style sheet containing a @function rule,

we invalidate every element whose style depends on a function.

This is fairly crude, but is sufficient for now.

entry.title: [LHS indicator] Blocked indicator does not override in-use indicator
entry.content:
This CL changes how a blocked camera and mic activity indicator is

displayed when a camera and/or mic is in-use. Camera and Microphone

are two permissions that are displayed via a single activity indicator.

This CL makes sure that if an in-use indicator is already displayed, it

will not be overridden by a blocked indicator.

entry.title: [remoting host] Implement SessionAuthz reauth
entry.content:
This CL implements the `SessionAuthzReauthorizer`, which is created by

the `SessionAuthzAuthenticator` and hooked up to the `JingleSession`.

It periodically talks to the SessionAuthz server for session reauth,

with some retry logic, and it closes the session if reauthorization

fails.

entry.title: Move CreateSharedImage params into a struct
entry.content:
This will make adding new params in the future much easier with much

smaller CLs.



This change starts with SharedImageInterface and stops before all of

the factory CreateSharedImage calls. I'll update those to use this

struct in a followup.



I decided to re-use the ClientSharedImage::Metadata struct, but decided

entry.title: [PIX] Do not crash if the frame is not active.
entry.content:
Before this patch, every inactive main frame triggered a CHECK() in the

ContentFacilitatedPaymentsDriverFactory class.



This patch replaces the CHECK() with a graceful `if(!active)return`.



After this patch, if a frame is not active, then PIX code detection will

not be run and there will not be a crash.



Bug: 326531940
